<<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|get~_form service formgen>> creates a ~G~E~T <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|~<form~>>>
      to <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|service>>~. ~The content of the <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|~<form~>>> is generated by the
      function <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|formgen>>~, that takes the names of the service
      parameters as parameters~. ~By default~, the <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|action>> attribute is
      a relative ~U~R~L recomputed at each request with <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|make~_uri>>~.


      ~By default~, the form is realized such that the client~-side ~Eliom
      application keeps running irrespectable of the usage of the form
      ~(cf~. <<a_api project="eliom" subproject="client" | val
      Eliom_client.change_page>> ~)~.


      ~By contrast~, if the optional parameter <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|~~xhr~:false>> is given~,
      the form is realized as a standard ~H~T~M~L form and submitting it
      discontinues the ~Eliom application~.  ~The <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|~~xhr>> parameter has no
      effect outside an ~Eliom application~.


      ~N~B that the default value of <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|~~xhr>> is configurable through
      <<a_api project="eliom" subproject="server" | val
      Eliom_config.set_default_links_xhr >> ~.


      ~The optional parameter <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|~~a>> allows one to add extra ~H~T~M~L
      attributes to the generated node~.


      ~See <<span class="odocwiki_inlinecode"|make~_uri>> for description of other optional
      parameters~.
